page.title: 13LHANBRYDE ARCHERY CLUB
page.content: {RECREATION:LHANBRYDE ARCHERY CLUB by members Richard Hay,Roddy Christie. This is one of the popular activities held at the village hall and adjoining village field all the year round. To encourage newcomers initial member- ship is very cheap,only Â£1.00 for six lessons. Equipment can be provided so that anyone interested can have the chance to take up archery. Equipment includes a bow,arrows,a bracer,a finger-tab and a quiver.A bracer is a piece of leather that prevents your arm being cut or scratched when you pull back the bowstring and let it go. A finger-tab is a cut piece of leather which is slipped on to your fingers to protect them from the vibrations of the bowstring.The target is round and four feet in diameter with differently coloured rings giving the scores.
